property.name: hbase.rootdir
property.description: The directory shared by region servers and into which HBase persists.

property.name: hbase.cluster.distributed
property.description: The mode the cluster will be in.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper ensemble.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: zookeeper.recovery.retry.maxsleeptime
property.description: Max sleep time before retry zookeeper operations in milliseconds.

property.name: hbase.master.port
property.description: The port the HBase Master should bind to.

property.name: hbase.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the HBase Master web UI. Set to -1 if you do not want a UI instance run.

property.name: hbase.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The bind address for the HBase Master web UI.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.port
property.description: The port the HBase RegionServer binds to.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port
property.description: The port for the HBase RegionServer web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the RegionServer UI to run.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the HBase RegionServer web UI

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port.auto
property.description: Whether or not the Master or RegionServer UI should search for a port to bind to.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.handler.count
property.description: Count of RPC Listener instances spun up on RegionServers. Same property is used by the Master for count of master handlers. Make it a multiple of CPU count.

property.name: hbase.ipc.server.callqueue.handler.factor
property.description: Factor to determine the number of call queues. A value of 0 means a single queue shared between all the handlers. A value of 1 means that each handler has its own queue.

property.name: hbase.hregion.max.filesize
property.description: Maximum HFile size. If the sum of the sizes of a region's HFiles has grown to exceed this value, the region is split in two.

property.name: hbase.master.logcleaner.plugins
property.description: A comma-separated list of BaseLogCleanerDelegate invoked by the LogsCleaner service.

property.name: hbase.master.logcleaner.ttl
property.description: How long a WAL remain in the archive ({hbase.rootdir}/oldWALs) directory, after which it will be cleaned by a Master thread.

property.name: hbase.unsafe.stream.capability.enforce
property.description:
Controls whether HBase will check for stream capabilities (hflush/hsync).
Disable this if you intend to run on LocalFileSystem, denoted by a rootdir with the 'file://' scheme, but be mindful of the NOTE below.
WARNING: Setting this to false blinds you to potential data loss and inconsistent system state in the event of process and/or node failures. If HBase is complaining of an inability to use hsync or hflush it's most likely not a false positive.
